Key Arguments: Free speech and argument are essential in a free society to counteract lies and deceptions.
Truth should prevail through non-interference, not government regulation.
Government or any entity should not interfere with free speech, even if it causes offense.
Establishing an eSafety Commissioner and a supporting bureaucracy is dangerous and biased.
Censorship results from an anointed truth in public circles.
Politicians, bureaucrats, and mainstream media should be held to the same standards of truthfulness.
Carriers of public discourse should not be held responsible for the content they carry.
Notable Quotes: Truth will prevail not from a Government appointed arbiter and more regulations, but by non-interference.
It is NOT the roll of any government or entity to interfere with free speech – irrespective if 'offense' might be caused.
Establishing a so called 'eSafety Commissioner,' and inevitably a large, expensive supporting bureaucracy to be the truth arbiter … is both dangerous and utterly biased.
